(constant) etags :Object

This object will hold the id and etags of each repository. Is there something to be said about using keys to store data? It seems wrong and also convenient.
Type:
  • Object
Source:
  • index.js, line 30
Example
{
    37756683: "a18c3bded88eb5dbb5c849a489412bf3"
}

constructMessageObject(id, name, invite, data)

Constructs a message as an object and then passes it to either shortenUrls if there URLs to be shortened or finaliseMessage if there are none.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
id String Discord server id.
name String Discord channel to be used.
invite String Url pulled from config to allow bot onto server.
data Object The data used to construct the message.
Source:
  • index.js, line 191

discordSuccess()

Discord has successfully been authorised. Check GitHub authorisation.
Source:
  • index.js, line 50

eventPollFailure(error)

Called when event polling fails. Also called when a 304 status is returned. 304 status means no changes were detected, so we return nothing and do not log an error.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
error Object The error object.
Source:
  • index.js, line 176

eventPollSuccess(id, name, repo, invite, response)

Called when a change is detected.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
id String Discord server id string.
name String Discord channel to be used.
repo Object Object pulled from config pertaining to the repo.
invite String Url pulled from config to allow bot on to server.
response Object The response from GitHub's API server.
Source:
  • index.js, line 122

finaliseMessage(text, urls, id, name, invite, type)

Replaces the placeholders for URLs with the shortened URLs and then passes the message to sendMessage. If bot is not connected to the specified server, it will attempt to connect and then send the messsage upon successful connection. If the bot cannot connect, an error will be sent and the message will be lost.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
text String The message text, passed through... :(
urls Array The URLs to be shortened.
id String Discord server id.
name String Discord channel to be used.
invite String Url pulled from config to allow bot onto server.
type String Event type.
Source:
  • index.js, line 253
To Do:
  • Message retention in case of failures... Shouldn't acutally be hard...

googleSuccess()

Google has successfully been authorised. Start the polling of GitHub's API.
Source:
  • index.js, line 77

loop()

This function runs every config.interval milliseconds. Default 5000. It loops through the configured subscriptions and then checks to see if any changes have been made. If changes were made to the repo, eventPollSuccess will fire. If no changes were made, eventPollFailure will fire and then silently return.
Source:
  • index.js, line 93

shortenUrls(text, urls, id, name, invite, type)

Shortens URLS using the Google URL shortener API. Instead of returning a list of shortened URLs when finished, this function calls finaliseMessage because I'm bad at promises.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
text String The message text, passed through... :(
urls Array The URLs to be shortened.
id String Discord server id.
name String Discord channel to be used.
invite String Url pulled from config to allow bot onto server.
type String Event type.
